brief.brief: The report header form to display report titles or headings.

detail.detail: Header is a user-defined form, printed at every top-of-page break.
Report Writer prints this form in addition to the master header. It usually contains column headings that explain the fields in the detail section of the report.

If you do not define a header form for a report but do specify Yes for the Print Master Header field and select Detail in the Summary/Detail field, Report Writer prints both the master header form and the detail form.

The maximum width of a report is 132 characters. If the header forms defined for a report exceed this limit, Report Writer sends them with their width to the spool file. However, when passed the printer, Service Manager truncates them to 132 characters, or the maximum width as defined in the config file for the printer used to print the report.
To change the width of a report, edit the Page Width field of the Client Printing section in the user's Operator record.
For details on completing the Operator record, see online help.
